1.text: The preparations of the heart are man’s, But the answer of the tongue is from the LORD.

2.text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; But the LORD weigheth the spirits.

3.text: Commit thy works unto the LORD, And thy thoughts shall be established.

4.text: The LORD hath made every things for His own purpose, Yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.

5.text: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD; My hand upon it! he shall not be unpunished.

6.text: By mercy and truth iniquity is expiated; And by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.

7.text: When a man’s ways please the LORD, He maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.

8.text: Better is a little with righteousness Than great revenues with injustice.

9.text: A man’s heart deviseth his way; But the LORD directeth his steps.

10.text: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king; His mouth trespasseth not in judgment.

11.text: A just balance and scales are the LORD’S; All the weights of the bag are His work.

12.text: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness; For the throne is established by righteousness.

13.text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; And they love him that speaketh right.

14.text: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death; But a wise man will pacify it.

15.text: In the light of the king’s countenance is life; And his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.

16.text: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! Yea, to get understanding is rather to be chosen than silver.

17.text: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil; He that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.

18.text: Pride goeth before destruction, And a haughty spirit before a fall.

19.text: Better it is to be of a lowly spirit with the humble, Than to divide the spoil with the proud.

20.text: He that giveth heed unto the word shall find good; And whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.

21.text: The wise in heart is called a man of discernment; And the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.

22.text: Understanding is a fountain of life unto him that hath it; But folly is the chastisement of fools.

23.text: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, And addeth learning to his lips.

24.text: Pleasant words are as a honeycomb, Sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

25.text: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, But the end thereof are the ways of death.

26.text: The hunger of the labouring man laboureth for him; For his mouth compelleth him.

27.text: An ungodly man diggeth up evil, And in his lips there is as a burning fire.

28.text: A froward man soweth strife; And a whisperer separateth familiar friends.

29.text: A man of violence enticeth his neighbour, And leadeth him into a way that is not good.

30.text: He shutteth his eyes, it is to devise froward things; He that biteth his lips bringeth evil to pass.

31.text: The hoary head is a crown of glory, It is found in the way of righteousness.

32.text: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; And he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

33.text: The lot is cast into the lap; But the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
